name: The Luxe Manor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I took advantage of the stay three/pay two deal that others have talked about here. With this deal, I think you would be hard pressed to beat this hotel. Our room was quiet, ample and clean. They also offered free internet which was a plus. My complaints about this hotel are fairly minor. It is overdesigned; a little too boutique-y, if you will. Others have complained about the breakfast situation. It is a bit of a cattle call and we did end up sharing a table with some folks. Not a big deal to me but I don't think this is a rare happening. They also go in for the aromatherapy here so there is a distinct smell to all the public areas of this place including the restaurant. It's not a bad smell but it's a smell. I would stay here again but only if it was a deal.
reviews.title: Great if you get a deal...
Beautifully eclectic little boutique hotel in the middle of Tsim Sha Tsui
reviews.text: It's a breath of fresh air from the rest of the 4/5* hotel chains. This boutique hotel has its own unique chram and character. The exterior is a vast difference from the interior. Outside seems to be an Imperial palace but once you're through the main doors, it's a completely different world. You're greeted by an eclectic mix of modern chic and faux victorian class.

reviews.title: Great little hotel (but my room had no view)
reviews.text: Our welcome was wonderful because we initially booked a studio but was upgraded to the deluxe room at no charge.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself was spacious and super comfy, with free coffee and internet. The faux victorian theme was maintained for the room decor, complete with a fake fireplace and many fake picture frames!
reviews.title: luxe manor? no more...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was in the hotel restaurant called Aspasia. Decent spread, can't say much cos I'm not a breafkast person, but loved the decor.
reviews.title: A funky experience

reviews.text: As I travelled to HK for my business trip, i selected Luxe manor from internet site. It was ever first that I selected this hotel but now I feel it will become my chioce number one during my next visit to HK.
reviews.title: My stay at The Luxe Manor HK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is so freindly and dedicated to make my stay a happy memory. I am very much impressed by the assistant manager Angela Mak. She did her real best to make my stay a very easy one. In fact she went out of way to get my computer fixed and helped me to get myself connected with my work station. I am sure that persons like Angela are real asset for any hotel and such people always get ahead in their profession.
reviews.title: Nice different, realtively spacious room for HK

reviews.text: Her followup had been remarkable.
reviews.title: Funky hotel conveniently located

reviews.text: Let me rate this hotel very high and recommend to every one who wants a comfortable ambience with dedicated people.
reviews.title: Bad, very bad

reviews.text: There were 4 of us in our party, with 2 different rooms.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a single night for a weekend getaway in Hong Kong. We both loved the eclectic decor. The room was spacious for HK, and very well appointed. The location is right in the heart of Tsim Sha Tsui, a conventient location for shopping and urban exploration.
reviews.title: lovely place to stay in TST

reviews.text: I think it was the perfect place for our little romantic holiday, I look forward to coming back.
reviews.title: Simply the nicest hotel I've stayed...

reviews.text: You feel att home, the decoration is nice, the service is really good. You will feel good in this beautiful and clean boutique hotel!!!
reviews.title: Quirky & eclectic, but not suitable for business travellers

reviews.text: The place where I stay when I come to HK. It makes business trip a pleasure!!!
reviews.title: Good stay at The Luxe

likes.disliked: — Walls were a bit thin, could hear the lift

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you to Angela Mok who has been so helpfull!
reviews.title: Good location and outlandish decor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had a memorable stay in The Luxe Manor. The hotel room is very special and atmosphere is very nice as wel. I love the location, which is located exactly in the city center. The concierge/FO team is very professional and helpful. They gave me extra information about everything, included some entertainment, quite reliable, well done!
reviews.title: Nice room, detail, but poor restaurant service

reviews.text: There is something I don't really feel well. It happened in the restaurant Aspasia, where I spent my birthday dinner with my darling . The restaurant staff didn't escort us to our table and I had to find somebody to do so. Finally, I found someone (the captain I guess), who escort us to our table, but the gentlemen(name is Jovi, which I heard from other staff) didn't eraise the menu and just throw the menu on our table, I felt really bad....
reviews.title: Nice and new

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I asked that guy (Mr.Jovi) to explain us more abut the menu, but seemed he had no mood to entertain us. I felt that he might not able to speak English well. He tried to explain us about the food & drink's combination, but the way he said was really ridiculous.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Finally he took our order, but he forgot our wine glasses. I asked about it and he really behaved very bad, without apologized and saying someone would bring me what I want. At that time I really hoped he knew someone would bring something for us. Moreover, he had really nice chat with his "friends",... I was wondering if the hotel allows staffs to gossip in front of the guest. They can say something bad behind, but don't let the guest know what they said, no foul language please.....
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: I suggest the hotel should offer some training for the staff who specially serve dinner. Apart from that, English and body language are important as well. Hospitality is about behaviour, even we had wonderful time in our room, breakfast service, concierge service, but the service of dinner made us rethink if the hotel should do better.
reviews.title: Great Location, Interesting Decor, but......

reviews.text: Took advantage of the hotel promotion & stayed 3 nites @ Luxe Manor. Go check out the hotel website if you're planning to stay there anytime this year. The winter special offer is unbeatable value!
reviews.title: certainly feel the luxe experience

likes.liked: — Quirky decor, conversational piece furniture, location, little turn down service snacks

reviews.text: The hotel is every inch a boutique establishment, from its small cozy set-up, fine finishings to its rather tiny rooms.
reviews.title: Fantastic new style Boutique property

likes.liked: — Innovative style - very comfortable beds, great bathroom making the best use of space - a bonus in Hong Kong
likes.disliked: — Free Internet - meant I had no excuse for not doing my e-mails!

reviews.text: Like many previous reviewers, i too dig the decor. A hint of Liberace, a little boudoir baroque. Lotsa wonderful conversational-piece furniture at the lobby, especially dig the show-piece chairs.
reviews.title: A Feast in the Eye - The Luxe Manor Hotel HK

likes.liked: — Hip decor, comfortable room, excellent service

aka: The Luxe Manor Hotel Hong Kong
description: A trend leader of designer hotels in Hong Kong with colorful and splendid European architecture offering excellent services and facilities to meet the needs of international business and leisure travellers. - The first designer boutique hotel in Kowloon with 153 rooms and 6 themed suites. - Located in the heart of Tsim Sha Tsui, a premier shopping and entertainment centre in Kowloon with direct access to major restaurants and bars at Knutsford Terrace.
